list_definition.definition: to arrive at (a place, age etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: We’ll never reach London before dark
Money is not important when you reach my age
Has the total reached a thousand dollars yet?
Have they reached an agreement yet?

list_definition.definition: to (be able to) touch or get hold of (something)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: My keys have fallen down this hole and I can’t reach them.

list_definition.definition: to stretch out one’s hand in order to touch or get hold of something

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He reached (across the table) for another cake
She reached out and took the book.

list_definition.definition: to make contact with; to communicate with

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: If anything happens you can always reach me by phone.
My property reaches from here to the river.

list_definition.mean_english: khoảng cách có thể qua được
list_definition.definition: the distance that can be travelled/traveled easily

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: My house is within (easy) reach (of London).

list_definition.definition: the distance one can stretch one’s arm

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: I keep medicines on the top shelf, out of the children’s reach
My keys are down that hole, just out of reach (of my fingers)
The boxer has a very long reach.

list_definition.definition: a straight part of a river, canal etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: the lower reaches of the Thames.

Through the process of decoding, a critical perspective can be reached on the reality previously perceived as impenetrable.
While clearly reaching thousands of citizens, they are still quite limited.
